step1.title: Configure Game
step1.desc: Set player count, your position, AI difficulty in the game config panel

step2.title: Click Start
step2.desc: Click the "Start Game" button, cards will be dealt automatically

step3.title: Wait for Your Turn
step3.desc: When it's your turn, the screen will show "Your Turn"

step1.title: Select Cards
step1.desc: Click cards in your hand to select them. Selected cards will be highlighted
step1.example: Example: Click 2 fives to make a pair, click 3 sevens to make a triple

step2.title: Click Play
step2.desc: After selecting cards, click the "Play" button. The system will validate if the card type is legal
step2.example: Note: You must beat the previous play, or this is a new round start (æŽ¥é£Ž)

step3.title: Wait for Result
step3.desc: After playing, the system will play audio, then it's the next player's turn

step1.title: Cannot Beat
step1.desc: If you don't have cards that can beat the previous play, you can click the "Pass" button

step2.title: Must Play
step2.desc: Note: If you have cards that can beat, the system will force you to play, you cannot choose "Pass"

hint.title: Use AI Suggestion
hint.desc: Not sure what to play? Click the "ðŸ¤– AI Suggestion" button, AI will recommend the best play for you

cardTypes.title: Card Types
cardTypes.pairDesc: Play 2 cards of the same rank, e.g., play two 5s
cardTypes.tripleDesc: Play 3 cards of the same rank, e.g., play three 7s
cardTypes.bombDesc: Play 4-6 cards of the same rank, e.g., play four Ks
cardTypes.dunDesc: Play 7 or more cards of the same rank, e.g., play seven As

beating.title: Beating Rules
beating.dunDesc: Dun can beat any non-dun card type (single, pair, triple, bomb)
beating.bombDesc: Bomb can beat any non-bomb, non-dun card type (single, pair, triple)
beating.sameTypeDesc: For the same card type, you need the same count and a higher rank to beat. For dun and bomb, the one with more cards wins; if same count, compare ranks
beating.passDesc: If you cannot beat the previous play, you can choose "Pass" to let the next player play

initial.title: Initial Score
initial.desc: At the start of the game, each player's initial score is -100 points

scoreCards.title: Score Cards
scoreCards.note: 5, 10, and K are score cards. When played, these cards are counted as round score

dun.title: Dun Scoring
dun.note: Each dun gives you 30 points from each other player. Dun count grows exponentially: 7 cards = 1 dun, 8 cards = 2 duns, 9 cards = 4 duns, 10 cards = 8 duns...

final.title: Final Scoring
final.firstDesc: The first player to finish gets +30 points
final.lastDesc: The last player to finish loses -30 points
final.bonusDesc: If the last player has unplayed score cards (5, 10, K), these points transfer to the second place player (by finish order)

strategy.title: Strategy Tips
strategy.tip1: Keep high cards and bombs for critical moments
strategy.tip2: Observe other players' plays to guess their hands
strategy.tip3: Be careful with score cards (5, 10, K), avoid letting others take them
strategy.tip4: Dun is very powerful, but use it at the right time, don't reveal it too early

timing.title: Timing
timing.tip1: When there's a lot of score in the round, try to win it
timing.tip2: If there's little score, consider passing and waiting for better opportunities
timing.tip3: After everyone passes (æŽ¥é£Ž), you can play any card type freely - this is a good opportunity

cooperation.title: Cooperation
cooperation.tip1: Observe other players' playing habits to understand their strategies
cooperation.tip2: In multiplayer games, sometimes you need to cooperate with others to counter the leading player
